ray.rage.asset.animation

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.asset.AbstractAsset
      • ray.rage.asset.animation.Animation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Asset, Disposable, Managed<AssetManager<? extends Asset>>, Nameable

    public final class Animation
extends AbstractAsset
    An Animation describes a sequence of frames that can be applied to a SkeletalEntity object. Each frame holds a list of transformations that are applied to each bone. The number of bones in an animation must match the number of bones in the SkeletalEntity Loading specific Animations is typically handled by the client at runtime to allow manual selection of Animations to be loaded per individual objects.
    Author:
    Luis Gutierrez

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDispose in interface Disposable
        Overrides:
        notifyDispose in class AbstractAsset
